text.headline: Human Evolution and Gender Roles
text.text: Evolutionary developments that have specifically influenced human gender roles, behaviours, and societal structures.

text.headline: Parental Investment Theory and Reproductive Strategies
text.text: Parental investment theory explains differences in male and female reproductive strategies based on investment in offspring, contributing to the development of gender roles (Del Giudice, 2009).

text.headline: Neanderthal Division of Labour.
text.text: Neanderthals had gender-specific roles, with men hunting and women gathering, influenced by ecological conditions and subsistence strategies (Kuhn & Stiner, 2006).
